Articles.Content:
I got into contact with the people updating the airship mod. Here's the link to the real page.

My original post follows...

Hello, I think I fixed my account. I'm Hooligan Labs who made the Airship mod and others long ago. I'll have some time over the holidays and I heard that the Airship mod was broken.

Is Jewel still here? Is there an interest in having me fix the Airship mod? I would probably throw in some features and updates as well.

Edited December 14, 2016 by Hooligan Labs

I loved the Hooligan Labs parts! I think there would be strong interest in an update, or even new* stuff if you felt up to it. Welcome back.

 

*A way cool part/system to add would be the inflatable airship from NASA's HAVOC concept for a manned Venusian upper-atmosphere mission.

The hooligan labs mod is alive and well has new models and updated

 

Suprised that you didn't contact him directly,  especially if you are who you claim to be.

Edited December 13, 2016 by SpannerMonkey(smce)

Yep it's me. You can check my profile for the lots of old posts I have.

Sorry, didn't know it was still running. I got a message on Youtube to fix the mod, and when I Googled it there were many comments (especially on Curse) that it was dead. Now that I opened the Spacedock page on my laptop I see under information that it was updated just last month. My bad.

Edited December 14, 2016 by Hooligan Labs
It's not only alive on its own, it's being actively used in development of others, kinda like Firesplitter.

Very cool. If the airship mod is doing fine maybe I'll try to fit a different mod in. I'm making progress on a physics-based walking mech thing, but I'll probably need help to do integration into KSP in any reasonable amount of time.

10 hours ago, Hooligan Labs said:

Very cool. If the airship mod is doing fine maybe I'll try to fit a different mod in. I'm making progress on a physics-based walking mech thing, but I'll probably need help to do integration into KSP in any reasonable amount of time.

Actually, the airship mod could definitely use some love in the graphics department IVAs are still awfully bare.
